Economic.q1: The team met the sprint's defined goals and objectives within the allocated budget
Economic.q2: Initiatives were in place to ensure job security for team members
Economic.q3: There were professional development opportunities for the team members
Economic.q4: The team supports learning and career advancement for team members
Economic.q5: Compensation structures within the team were fair
Economic.q6: The project positively contributed to economic growth in its community or industry
Economic.q7: The team actively sought ways to contribute to the economic wellbeing of stakeholders
Economic.q8: Efforts were made to minimize the environmental impact of the project's infrastructure
Economic.q9: The team invested in innovative technologies or practices to improve efficiency
Economic.q10: Innovation was a priority in project planning and execution
Economic.q11: The team actively engages in activities that enhance the competitiveness of the industry
Economic.q12: Resources, including time and personnel, were allocated efficiently throughout the project
Economic.q13: The team conducted cost-benefit analyses for major project decisions
Economic.q14: The team prioritizes activities with a positive cost-benefit ratio
Economic.q15: Decisions were made with a focus on maximizing the project's economic benefits

Social.q1: Team members communicate with one another effectively
Social.q2: The team demonstrates empathy and support for each other's well-being
Social.q3: There is a sense of shared responsibility in the team
Social.q4: The team celebrates team milestones and achievements to boost morale and team spirit
Social.q5: Individual achievements and contributions are acknowledged and recognised
Social.q6: Tools for collaboration (eg repositories, issue boards) are used effectively within the team
Social.q7: Team members are comfortable with raising issues and addressing conflict openly
Social.q8: Conflicts within the team are resolved in a constructive manner
Social.q9: The team fosters an inclusive and diverse environment
Social.q10: As a team member, you feel a sense of belonging and inclusion
Social.q11: Team members provide constructive feedback to each other
Social.q12: The team can adapt well to changes in the projects requirements
Social.q13: The team are open to new suggestions and are continuously trying to improve the standard of work
Social.q14: Decisions are made collectively and all opinions are heard

Technical.q1: The software I developed is robust
Technical.q2: Any code I pushed to the SCM was thoroughly tested
Technical.q4: My teammates performed regular code reviews on my code
Technical.q5: I implemented load/stress testing where appropriate to ensure that the project can handle peak loads efficiently
Technical.q6: I conduct regular performance testing to identify bottlenecks and areas of improvement
Technical.q7: I used CI/CD pipelines where appropriate for automated testing, performance monitoring & deployment
Technical.q8: The team conformed to an agreed upon change management style - eg commit strategy - to maintain consistency
Technical.q9: The code I pushed to the SCM was documented thoroughly and appropriately
Technical.q10: The code I pushed to the SCM was clean and readable
Technical.q11: I was able to understand the code of my teammates due to appropriate documentation
Technical.q12: The project is portable and interoperable between different operating systems, browsers, languages etc
Technical.q13: The team are open to new suggestions and are continuously trying to improve the standard of work
Technical.q14: The software developed took the accessibility into account
Technical.q15: Error messages are included in the software where appropriate

Individual.q1: You felt a ‘sense of accomplishment’ and personal growth during this sprint
Individual.q2: You feel that you can maintain a healthy work-life balance whilst working on this project
Individual.q4: You feel that there are appropriate measures are in place to address and mitigate stress and burnout
Individual.q5: You feel that your health and wellbeing are prioritised
Individual.q6: Your personal time and boundaries are being respected
Individual.q7: You feel that work was spread evenly and fairly among yourself and other team members
Individual.q8: You have opportunities for skill development or career advancement
Individual.q9: Your work arrangements were flexible - ie, you were able to work remotely if necessary
Individual.q10: You feel supported in balancing personal and professional commitments
Individual.q12: You feel that your personal individual contributions and accomplishments are acknowledged and celebrated
Individual.q13: You have a clear understanding of your role within the team and what is expected of you
Individual.q14: Constructive feedback is provided to support individual growth
Individual.q15: Mentorship programs or supportive relationships are available for team members

Environmental.q1: The team is consistently looking to optimize code for energy efficiency
Environmental.q2: The team is conscious of the environmental impact related to energy use in software development
Environmental.q3: Sustainable development practices are integrated into the team's workflow
Environmental.q4: Code review processes include considerations for the environmental impact of the codebase where appropriate
Environmental.q5: Environmental impact is a factor in the selection of technologies and tools for the project, eg servers
Environmental.q6: The team makes an effort to reduce waste in terms of time and resources during the development process
Environmental.q7: The team seeks out and adopts green technologies and practices where appropriate
Environmental.q8: The team considers the environmental impact of hardware disposal in its decision-making processes by creating software which is backwards compatible with older devices
Environmental.q9: Plans are in place for the responsible disposal or recycling of hardware rendered obsolete by software development or updates
Environmental.q10: Cloud-based solutions are optimized for efficiency to minimize environmental impact
Environmental.q11: On-premises data centers, if used, are operated sustainably with environmental considerations
Environmental.q12: Carbon emissions related to development activities are monitored and addressed by the team
Environmental.q13: Strategies are in place to offset or mitigate the environmental impact of the team's activities, eg investing in carbon offset programs
Environmental.q14: Efforts are made to transition to or support renewable energy providers
Environmental.q15: The team actively seeks feedback on its environmental sustainability practice
